title: PERFECT FOR SAMSUNG !!!
comment: add the abbillity to access hidden settings

title: Saved my Note 4
comment: The moment I realised native SIP was not available on my freshly bought Note 4, while one reason for buying it was actually that I wanted a Samsung device which were known to come with Android native SIP... I almost threw the device off the window. But then I found this fantastic widget. Thank you, and hats off to the developer, it works like a charm!

title: Super useful!
comment: If it could have a app version would be great.

title: Not working on Note 4 (T-mobile USA)
comment: The widget was able to bring up the configuration page. However I was not able to make calls through VOIP....Dear developer, is there a workaround? 1star only to bring your attention, sorry for that.

If you cannot access the SIP settings via the default phone settings, SIP is probably disabled by your carrier branding. In this case, there's nothing I can do about it. I only can recommend using another firmware (e.g. Cyanogen) or buying another phone.

title: Feature Request
comment: Excellent Job!  It would be complete with a switch to enable receive SIP Calls or not.

title: Excellent Work
comment: I was looking SIP native settings in my Note 4 and couldn't found anywhere and amazingly I installed this widget and boom it gives me the access to the native SIP client and configuration and it work like a charm thank you.

title: Just a widget, but very useful
comment: My LG G3 does not have a menu for "Internet Call" SIP configuration (some companies do that), but this Widget does and its perfect for changing from my sip account to the cellular.

title: Just works
comment: Wish there was an option to choose how many and which button to put om screen cause I only needed the left button and it would be nice to have it only occupy a 1x1 site

title: Perfect! Works as it should!
comment: Not only does this enable and disable SIP on my Motorola Pro+, but it also provides a shortcut to the SIP settings, which are normally not accessible on my phone. Excellent Work!

title: Great app
comment: i just wish there was an icon for directly enabling/disabling incoming calls (left button opens settings for that but i'd rather do it in one click)
This is unfortunately not possible, Android's API doesn't allow this.

title: Perfect!
comment: Installed, quickly configured, used! The kind of app that doesn't do a lot but does it well, and simply.

title: Simple, good app
comment: Just the way I like my apps. Simple and works. I am using this with my Nexus 5 running Kit Kat. One icon shortcuts me to the screen for enabling/disabling incoming calls. The other icon shortcuts for whether I want outgoing phone calls to use VOIP or not. Awesome. Well done!  If I could improve anything I'd want the 'receive calls' button to not be just a shortcut, but actually toggle the setting. Not sure if this is possible with Google's APIs.

title: Gets the job done.
comment: Simple and effective, great job!

title: The best widget for SIP
comment: Must have stuff
Great
Brilliant Widget

title: Very handy
comment: I use my VOIP number for work but want to turn off incoming calls when not in the office. This widget makes it a lot simpler.

title: Exactly
comment: If you need this functionality this is the application you seek. It works great with my Google Nexus running SlimRoms. Thank you Robert for the effort you put into app.

title: Best SIP Switch Widget
comment: After looking for a widget that would work with my gagaphone account I came across this piece jewel. My calls are loud and clear.
Very nice!

title: Just was I was looking
comment: This is great widget although I need for a bit different purpose. I needed a quick shotcut to the sip settings so I can enable og disable recieving calls. You would get 5 stars if you added a enable receive toggle :-)

title: Unable to use it after last update
comment: Unfortunately now l can't get easy access to the ''Receive Incoming Calls'' Setting to connect my phone to my SIP provider. Therefore, even If I enable SIP calls by your widget, I can't make any call until l manually connect my phone to the SIP provider.  You should either return the possibility to get to the setting or switch it on automatically.
You just have to enlarge the widget, this will unveil the settings button.

title: Womt receive calls on att Samsung Galaxy S 3
comment: I can make calls not receive them
This is most certainly an issue of the phone or the SIP settings. The widget does not influence the phone's ability to make or receive calls.

title: Why didnt anybody make this earlier
comment: Thanks. Simple and useful.

title: Excellent, less is more
comment: I've started using an SIP account for calls, but access to the settings are a little hidden away in Android. I need to toggle them often.  This widget lets you toggle the settings directly from your home screen and does the job quickly and easily with no fuss.  Good work!

title: Great, useful widget!
comment: Great widget for toggling IP calls! I would make only a few recommendations: 1) create a 1x1 widget to toggle statuses on each click, with a long press to access IP call settings instead of forcing the widget to be 2x1; 2) make a toggle to receive incoming SIP calls, too. Otherwise, it is perfect. Thank you!

title: Great!
comment: This is exactly what I needed, very simple widget, does the job.

title: Just brilliant
comment: Well done whoever you are. This is exactly what I have been looking for. I go away a lot to Europe and find this widget really useful.

title: Good apps! Should come on stock os
comment: I email the developer because I couldn't' see the widget after installing it. He suggested rebooting the phone and it worked!

title: Like a boss
comment: Great app Dev keeps this app always updated 5stars

title: Updated button function
comment: This update is definitely an improvement over previous versions, because activing SIP via the widget was always 50/50...sometimes it would activate it successfully, but other times, using the widget would cause the settings to say "Account registration unsuccessful", whereas it would work 100% of the time doing it the long way. I appreciate the fact that the button is now a direct shortcut to the setting in question, but as a reviewer already mentioned, it would be good to leave the indicator on the button so that finding out whether SIP is on or off is as easy as taking a quick glance.

title: Update is not good
comment: This was incredible wIth 5 stars, but without the first button lighting up green, it is not easy to know if sip is on or not.  Please, please change back or allow some indication that sip is on.  Please.

title: Simple but works.
comment: I'll be releasing a similar app soon on xda compatible with tasker

title: Tasker
comment: Me want tasker plugin too!

title: If only...
comment: Doesn't seem to work with ICS. Might have something to do with the new integrated dialer.
Please try again with the latest version!

title: Works Great!
comment: Much easier than hunting through the menus to turn on and off internet calling. It would be even better if this was a Tasker plugin. Then I could automate it when I'm connected to Wi-Fi.

title: Doesn't work
comment: Doesn't work on my DHD. Gives error and the widget stays blank black buttons.
Please try again with the latest version!

title: Fantastic
comment: Only app/widget of it's kind. Would love to see this as a Tasker plugin...
